channel.title: Posts on Techtaste
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Techtaste

item.title: TCPDUMP cmd
item.description: tcpdump -i any To get the network packets from all network interfaces, run the following command, get packets on localhost with port 8288 tcpdump -i lo0 port 8288 tcpdump -i eth0 get the network packets from a single interface tcpdump -i eth0 -w wirte_file_name write all the captured packets to a file, use the ‘-w’ option, tcpdump -r packets_file read an already created, old tcpdump file.

item.title: Sys Admin Cmds
item.description: lscpu list of cpus. lsmem list of memory. lsof (list open files) lsof -i tcp:80 df (disk free space) Display free disk space Filesystem Size Used Avail Use% Mounted on /dev/xvda1 32G 4.7G 26G 16% / tmpfs 1.9G 0 1.9G 0% /dev/shm du (disk space usage) du - estimate file space usage du -sh /var/* id $ id uid=501(operations) gid=100(users) groups=100(users) curl curl -I -s google.

item.title: Linux network commands
item.description: Ifconfig Used to configure network interface parameters. Checking ip of the machine. traceroute Print the route packets take to network host. dig(Domain information groper) Dig (domain information groper) query DNS related information like A Record, CNAME, MX Record etc telnet Connects to host on given port using telnet protocal. If connection successful then host is working fine. nslookup It queries internet domain name servers. Options

item.title: How To Use Vdock Tool
item.description: Vdock for quickly deploying a site on to Github Go to Vdock Github project

item.title: Markdown guide
item.description:
Below are the basic syntaxes for writing markdown pages.

Highlighting

**bold**
__bold__

*Emphasis*
_Emphasis_

bold

bold

Emphasis

Emphasis

Lists

Unordered List

* list item 1
* list item 2
	* sub list item 1
	* sub list item 2
		* nested sub list item 1
		* nested sub list item 2
  • list item 1
  • list item 2
    • sub list item 1
    • sub list item 2
      • nested sub list item 1
      • nested sub list item 2

Ordered List

1. list item 1
2. list item 2
	1. sub list item 1
	2. sub list item 2
		1. nested sub list item 1
		2. nested sub list item 2
